byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Gelugor, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong. Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: More than 3,000 migrants from Bangladesh and Myanmar who were adrift at sea are now waiting in bureaucratic limbo in Indonesia and Malaysia that could continue indefinitely; few countries want to take migrants and there is huge logjam of applicants seeking resettlement.
lead_paragraph: While the refugees wait for citizenship or resettlement, they are not allowed to work or send their children to government-accredited schools.

headline.main: Migrants Flooding Into Malaysia and Indonesia Trade One Nightmare for Another
headline.print_headline: Thousands Wait in Southeast Asia, Lost in Time

snippet: While the refugees wait for citizenship or resettlement, they are not allowed to work or send their children to government-accredited schools.

keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
keywords.name: organizations
